title: Is there another word for “synonym”? - Quora

response.answer_text: "Simile" is another word for "synonym." Does that, give you enough to  s m i l e  about? Because I am a World Class writer...the last time I recall checking a dictionary or thesaurus was a decade ago. But then, within the last two months, I Googled the "odd" word to clarify any residual discrepancies floating 'round in my mind. Very often, one hears the expression: "What's synonymous with that...?" Meaning: "likliest to go with." You can use "equivalent," but because this word is even bandied about in chemistry & physics, only "word-equivalent," suffices for ...synomyn. Similar is the adjectival of "simile," the word I suggest. Also there's "commonality" and a host of countless words that ALL fall short for one reason only. These are also used in OTHER contexts...too. And believe me, English Lit., is so persnickety about "proprietary exclusion" that you need "grammatic wording" only..to match with its own. So short of "inventing" dozens for you...e.g. "synchronym"(for one)..."simile" is  t h e  most appropriate...by far.          ☆  ☆  ☆  ☆ w

synonym - equivalent word Two words that can be interchanged in a context are said to be synonymous adj. (Meaning the same or nearly the same.) relative to that context. similar 1. Resembling or similar; having the same or some of the same characteristics; often used in combination.2. Having the same or similar characteristics.3. Capable of replacing or changing places with something else; permitting mutual substitution without loss of function or suitability.4. Marked by correspondence or resemblance.5. (Of words) Expressing closely related meanings.substitutable 1. Capable of being exchanged for another or for something else that is equivalent.2. (Of words) Interchangeable in a given context without changing the import of the expression.alike - Having the same or similar characteristics. alternate - Serving or used in place of another. exchangeable - Capable of replacing or changing places with something else; permitting mutual substitution without loss of function or suitability. interchangeable - Capable of replacing or changing places with something else; permitting mutual substitution without loss of function or suitability. similitude -  Similarity in appearance or character or nature between persons or things. kinship - A close connection marked by community of interests or similarity in nature or character. The last two may be a stretch, but I like them. Thank you for the Ask to Answer!
